channel.title: Peter Julian
channel.description: Recent news about Peter Julian, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Mentioned by Burnaby Now
item.description:
City NDP MPs call for debate, more aid for Syrians
While the U.S. pushes for military intervention, Burnaby-New Westminster MP Peter Julian wants Prime Minister Stephen Harper to recall Parliament for a debate on Canada's role in the conflict. Photograph by: Contibuted/BURNABY NOW. Previous Next.

item.title: Mentioned by Cowichan Valley Citizen
item.description:
New Democrat MPs join parade of politicians through Valley
NDP MPs Peter Julian (Burnaby-New Westminster) and Jinny Sims (Newton-North Delta) said prorogation or not, they were headed to Vancouver Island this week. Photograph by: Sarah Simpson/Citizen. Previous Next. NDP MPs Peter Julian (Burnaby-New ... Then it was federal NDP Leader Tom Mulcair who joined Nanaimo-Cowichan MP Jean Crowder for a visit at North Cowichan's Kinsmen Neighbourhood Park last Friday morning. MP Duncan was back later Friday afternoon in Cowichan Bay for another funding ...

item.title: Mentioned by Hill Times (subscription)
item.description:
Taking a balanced approach to resource development
Our oilsands are a natural resource blessing, but we have an obligation to value our environmental and economic assets like true owners. NDP MP Peter Julian represents Burnaby-New Westminster, B.C., and is the NDP's Energy and Natural Resources critic ...

item.title: Mentioned by MINING.com
item.description:
Checking in with Canada's shadow resource critic
MINING.com spoke to MP Peter Julian last month, a likely candidate for the country's next resource minister if the NDP were to form the next federal government. Julian, the NDP's Energy and Natural Resources Critic, says that some of the regulations his party ...

item.description:

item.title: Mentioned by Vancouver Sun
item.description:
Senate debate coming to doorstep near you
B.C. MP Peter Julian says British Columbians have the best reason in the country for junking the upper chamber. The province has the worst per-capita representation in the Senate, accounting for just six of the 102 seats compared to 10 for tiny New ...
